node.text:
Water is life. Our very existence depends on water 💧. Yet, this valuable resource is becoming increasingly scarce.

Our Ocean Advocate @CodySimpson shares his poem ✍️ on water, #oceans and our environment.

Join us to protect this precious resource #ForPeopleForPlanet.

#Poem #Poetry #SharePoetry #ShareCulture #Ocean #GlobalGoals #SDGs #ValuingWater #EveryDrop #SDG6 #CleanSeas #BeatPlasticPollution #ClimateAction

node.text:
@TheLionsShare is a groundbreaking UNDP initiative with one simple yet pressing goal: raising funds to tackle our growing global #biodiversity and climate crisis. But we need everyone’s help. Every new follow empowers #TheLionsShare to ask brands to join in protecting our planet. When you speak, the world listens and your voice has phenomenal power to help @TheLionsShare roar. Follow to become part of the solution.

#climatechange #sdg13

node.text: Sir @davidattenborough shared his message #ForNature to world leaders during the @UN Biodiversity Summit this week. Over 70 world leaders took a #LeadersPledge4Climate to halt the biodiversity crisis. But we need more nations to step up and turn promises into action.

node.title: Sir David Attenborough’s message to world leaders

node.text: Calling all young people to share ways to care for nature. Share your Time #ForNature video message on social media starting on World Environment Day and tag @undp, @unep, & @lionssharefund. We’ll amplify your message to world leaders in September & share select ones on our social media this World Youth Day on 12 August.

node.text: We are all dependent on the natural world yet our planet is facing a biodiversity crisis. Hear from Sir David Attenborough. We have the power to do our part to protect nature.

node.text: The Kisêdjê’s culture was on the brink of collapse until they began a movement to plant Pequi trees on deforested soil & process the fruit for sale. See how they’re reviving cultural identity & healing the Amazon Rainforest.

node.title: Planting trees in the Amazon: the Kisêdjê and the story of pequi fruits

node.text: Meet Ahmad, Soraya and their children. They are seeking asylum in Malaysia after escaping ISIS in Syria. Their story is the first episode in the Season 3 premiere of #ExtremeLives, a digital storytelling series from @undpasiapacific, @facebook, and @europeancommission to spotlight the stories from Asia of people surviving violent extremism.

node.text: Albania is rebuilding after a 6.4 magnitude earthquake struck in November 2019. The earthquake was the strongest that Albania has experienced in the past 30 years. Nearly 220,000 people have been affected. Thousands of buildings were destroyed and left many families living the cold winter in tents. Limya El Tayeb, the head of @undpalbania, explains how #Albania, @unitednations, @worldbank, & @europeancommission are working together on earthquake recovery. #together4albania

node.text: 🌧 or 🌞, Malek Awaji spends eight hours a day everyday, sometime in minus zero 🥶 or 40C+ 🥵 🌡weather on top of this ⛰ in Jordan. Over 1.5 million migratory birds travel through this busy transit hub as they migrate between Europe, Asia, and Africa. Watch the rest of the video from @undpjordan to learn why his work is so important for global bird conservation. #birdsofinstagram #birdwatching #biodiversity #savetheplanet

node.text:
(Tap on the Instagram 📺 icon on the lower left corner to watch in full vertical mode) Trenchtown has inspired Bob Marley and put Jamaican music on the global map. Today, Garfield, a community leader and artist, is reviving Jamaican sculpture. Through UNDP's Development Minerals Programme financed by the European Commission,  affordable local clay and alabaster are now available to artists who used to struggle with the high cost of imported raw materials. The final products range from fine arts to souvenirs distributed wholesale to tourism retailers, @sandalsresorts gift shops across #JamaicaTourism networks. 
@undpjamaica

node.title: Art transforms the birthplace of Jamaican reggae

node.text:
Marie sprinkles her "Shanklish" with a bit of thyme but loads of love! ❤
 
#Shanklish is a classic Levantine appetizer made from yogurt whey. Once the yogurt is drained from water, it is formed into balls and then coated with dried thyme or chili. It can be aged and dried for a long time.
 
From the comfort of her home, Marie produces traditional "Mouneh" to support her family in Bekaa.  This is an old food tradition especially in rural villages in Lebanon (and many other countries in the region). It involves the annual processing of vegetables, fruits, spices, herbs, and animal by-products to be later stored away in a pantry. The preserves are to be consumed all year long.
 
Together with our partners, @undp_lebanon supports women-led cooperatives contributing to the achievement of #GenderEquality and leading the path towards sustainable economic development, social integration, & productivity in #Lebanon.
 
📸: @nogarlicnoonions
.
.
.
#GenerationEquality #GlobalGoals #LeaveNoOneBehind #BuildForwardBetter ⁠#UNDP @ukinlebanon, @usembassybeirut, @germanyinlebanon #KfW Development Bank @norwayinlebanon

node.text:
Punta del Diablo, a small coastal town in eastern #Uruguay, sits between the Atlantic Ocean and the 17,500 hectare Black Lagoon. Native trees such as the Arrayàn, Chal Chal and Curupì, are increasingly threatened by alien species, unplanned urban development, and unsustainable tourism. Only 4.8% of Uruguay’s land is now covered by native forests🌲🌲🌲.
 
A group of local people have decided to reverse that trend and despite the winter’s cold, have gathered in a local park to start work.
 
“The restoration of native #forests is very important for Uruguay. Most people don’t know about our native trees, they have no idea,” says Katherine Muller, a local entrepreneur. She and the other volunteers start clearing the land of remains of black acacias and maritime pines, invasive exotics that displace native species and are quickly reborn when fires sweep through.
 
Their concerns are shared by @pnud_uruguay’s Accelerator Lab, and ‘Plantatón Uruguay’ which has begun planting 1,000 trees to restore Punta del Diablo’s native forest. The initiative will encourage individual commitment and collective financing through crowdsourcing.
 
Uruguay has been inspired by experiences from other countries such as Uzbekistan which is bringing life back to the Aral Sea, and Costa Rica’s Huella de Futuro, which is planting 200,000 trees in the country’s North Zone.
 
#NativeForests 🌱 are home to 9 out of 10 indigenous reptiles, birds, and mammals, including threatened species. They are essential to protect biodiversity, the environment, and water quality.
 
Each tree represents a person committed to Uruguay’s ecosystem and a footprint of hope.
 
Read the full story in the link in our bio.
 
📸: Antártida Films 
.
.
.
#PlantatónUruguay #GenerationRestoration #Forest #Nature #ForNature #ForPeopleForPlanet #Biodiversity #Environment #Sustainbility #Conservation #Ecosystems#GlobalGoals #SDG15 @plantatonuruguay @pnudlac

node.text:
At 8:30am on 14 August 2021, a 7.2-magnitude #earthquake struck Haiti’s coast destroying parts of the country’s third largest city, Les Cayes, and surrounding areas.
 
While the official death toll continues to rise, more than 2,000 people have been killed and thousands of buildings have been destroyed or damaged. Relief and recovery efforts are hindered by debris blocking roads and vital infrastructure.
 
We have worked in #Haiti for over 40 years. We stand ready to support their people and government to address immediate critical needs and help recover in the aftermath of the #HaitiEarthquake and hurricane #Grace.
.
.
.
📷: Moïse Pierre
 
#WorldHumanitarianDay @pnudlac

node.text:
Today, 2.2 billion people lack access to safely managed drinking water, and more than 4.2 billion people lack safely managed sanitation, even though both services have been recognized as #HumanRights for over a decade.
 
#ClimateChange is exacerbating the situation, with increasing disasters such as floods and droughts. By 2050, it is projected that at least 1 in 4 people will suffer recurring water shortages.
 
The #COVID19 pandemic poses an additional impediment, impairing access to safely managed drinking water, sanitation and hygiene – services desperately needed to prevent the virus from spreading.
 
Now more than ever the world needs to transform the way it manages its water resources, and delivers water and sanitation services for billions of people.
 
Safe and affordable drinking water 💧 for all by 2030 requires that we invest in adequate infrastructure, provide sanitation facilities, and encourage hygiene. Protecting and restoring water-related ecosystems is also essential.
 
Learn more about water and the #GlobalGoals in the link in our bio.

📸: @undpindonesia/Fauzan Ijazah
.
.
.
#SafeHands #SDGs #ValuingWater #EveryDrop #SDG6

node.text:
This week’s @IPCC #ClimateReport is a code red for humanity 🛑.
 
#ClimateChange is widespread, rapid, and intensifying. It is affecting every region on Earth, and the changes we experience will increase with further warming.
 
Human activities are causing climate change and making extreme climate events, including heat waves, heavy rainfall, and droughts, more frequent and severe.
 
But we still have the potential to determine the future course of the climate.
 
Strong, rapid, and sustained reductions in greenhouse gas emissions are required to stabilize the climate and keep our goal of limiting temperature increase 🌡️ to 1.5°C within reach.
 
More in the link in our bio.
.
.
.
#IPCC #IPCCData #ActNow #GlobalGoals #SDG13

node.text:
August 12 is #WorldElephantDay! 🐘⁠
⁠
These amazing creatures need to be protected. Among the biggest threats to elephants are poaching, human-wildlife conflict and habitat loss, exacerbated by #ClimateChange.⁠
⁠
Analyzing DNA from seized #elephant ivory adds teeth to the fight against the illegal #wildlife trade. Wildlife DNA forensics, a unique and relatively new tool, has the potential to hold traffickers accountable for the crimes they commit against wildlife, ecosystems and all of humanity. ⁠
⁠
Read the full story in the link in our bio.⁠
⁠
📸: Shutterstock⁠
.⁠
.⁠
.⁠
#WorldElephantDay2021 #WorldElephantDay #ElephantDay #Elephants #EndIllegalWildlifeTrade #ForNature #conservation #Biodiversity #SDG15

node.text:
Today is #WorldLionDay! 🦁
 
See some @WWF facts below:
 
🐾Nearly all wild #lions live in #Africa, and some in western India
🐾Their manes attract females and protect their neck and head from injuries
🐾They are the only cats who roar together
🐾Lions do most of their hunting at night; their eyes are adapted to the dark
 
In the last two decades alone, lion populations have dropped by more than 40%. They are threatened mostly by illegal #wildlife trade, habitat and food loss, #ClimateChange and retaliatory or preemptive killing.
 
Today and every day, let’s raise awareness about the protection of our planet and all its species.
 
📸: Shutterstock
.
.
.
#Biodiversity #SDG15 #Biodiversity #ForNature #Nature #GlobalGoals #Wildlife #WildForLife #Conservation #WildLifePhotography #NaturePhotography #LionDay

node.text:
Indigenous peoples are…

🌱Guardians of the environment
💜Practitioners of unique cultures
🦋Protectors of biodiversity
 
There are over 476 million indigenous peoples living in 90 countries and representing 5,000 different cultures. They make up 6.2% of the global population and speak a majority of the world’s 7,000 languages.
 
On #IndigenousDay and every day, we must protect indigenous peoples’ rights and maintain their distinct traditions and way of life.
 
More in the link in our bio.
 
📸: Shutterstock; @pnud_peru; @undpkenya; @undp_in_bhutan; @undpinpng; @pnud_peru; @pnud_brasil; @pnud_peru
.
.
.
#WeAreIndigenous #IndigenousDay #IndigenousPeoplesDay #IndigenousPeople #IndigenousCommunities #IndigenousWomen #ForPeopleForNature #LeaveNoOneBehind #HumanRights

node.text:
“As we encroach on nature and deplete vital habitats, increasing numbers of species are at risk. That includes humanity and the future we want.” - @unitednations Secretary-General @antonioguterres 
 
Around 1 million animal and plant species are threatened with extinction – many within decades. Human activity is putting immense pressure on the planet leading to crises like COVID-19, #ClimateChange and mass extinctions. Business as usual is not an option. It is vital to work with and not against nature.
 
#Nature is critical to our survival: nature provides us with our oxygen, regulates our weather patterns, pollinates our crops, produces our food, feed and fibre. But it is under increasing stress. Human activity has altered almost 75% of the earth’s surface, squeezing wildlife and nature into an ever-smaller corner of the planet.
 
The way we farm, use our soils, protect coastal and marine ecosystems, and treat our forests will make or break our future, but it can also help us to be healthier, safer and more prosperous.
.
.
.
#Biodiversity #Amphibians #Animals #Ecosystems #ForNature #GlobalGoals #SDGs #SDG14 #GenerationRestoration #Wildlife #Conservation
